question:
You are a code expert; please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Try to ensure the generated code is executable for demonstration. ======== ROLE ========
You are an experienced code expert. I will provide you with a software development requirement description, and you need to generate project code based on these requirements. Strictly follow the rules to help users generate complete project code with simple and easy-to-understand comments, without outputting anything else.

======== OUTPUT RULES ========
1. You should always generate complete runnable project code, please ensure the project is fully executable
2. Ensure all code files you output are complete, do not omit any code
3. Before the final output, carefully review and check all code to evaluate its executability. If the code cannot be executed or contains errors, it needs to be regenerated
4. If the requirements involve external API access or need to use user data (images, videos, audio, etc.), please provide simulated data

======== PROJECT REQUIREMENTS DESCRIPTION ========
Design an online platform that can be used to convert videos to GIF animation files. After uploading a video, users can select the start and end times, and adjust the output GIF's resolution and frame rate, preview the generated effect in real-time, and download the final file.

checklist.title: Is the video to GIF conversion core functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code implements the complete pipeline from video uploading to GIF generation. This includes video loading, time segment selection, conversion processing, and download functionality.Score 0 if conversion functionality is missing, 5 if basic conversion works but with limitations, and 10 if the full pipeline works seamlessly with proper error handling.

checklist.title: Are all required customization parameters implemented?
checklist.description: Verify the implementation of all required customization options: start/end time selection, resolution adjustment, and frame rate control. Check if these parameters properly affect the output GIF.Deduct 2 points for each missing parameter. Deduct 3 points if parameters don't effectively impact the output. Full score requires intuitive UI controls for each parameter with appropriate ranges and defaults.

checklist.title: Is the real-time preview functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the solution provides real-time or near-real-time preview of the GIF based on the current parameter settings. Check if previews update when parameters change.Score 0 if preview is missing, 5 if preview exists but isn't responsive to parameter changes, and 10 if preview accurately reflects all parameter changes within 2 seconds of adjustment.

checklist.title: Is the download functionality complete and user-friendly?
checklist.description: Check if the generated GIF can be properly downloaded, with appropriate file naming, quality preservation, and progress indication during processing.Deduct 3 points if download doesn't work reliably, 2 points if no progress indication is provided, and 2 points if file naming is not handled properly. Full score requires proper content disposition and mime types.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as unsupported file formats, large files, browser limitations, processing errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms.Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Batch processing 2. Additional filters/effects for GIFs 3. Social sharing capabilities 4. GIF optimization options).Add 2.5 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions 2. Function modules unrelated to video-to-GIF conversion 3. Fancy effects that affect performance and load times.Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating video processing/UI/file handling layers), error handling, performance optimization, and build process automation.Deduct 3 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 3 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 4 points if the processing is inefficient or unoptimized. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching 2) Proper layout spacing 3) Professional font system 4) Intuitive video timeline representation.Deduct 2 points for each crowded visual element, 3 points for poor color combinations, 3 points for chaotic layout, and 2 points for unintuitive time selection controls. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the platform responsive and cross-browser compatible?
checklist.description: Judge whether the platform works across different screen sizes and major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge), and whether it provides appropriate loading states during processing.Deduct 2.5 points for each major browser with compatibility issues, 3 points for poor mobile/tablet adaptation, and 2 points for missing loading indicators or progress feedback. The full score is 10 points.
